pages.text: Originally thought to be a trigonotarbid, Attercopus was later redescribed as the most primitve version of a true spider. Attercopus did not have spinnerets, however, it still would have produced silk from spigots located across the abdomen. It also had a segmented tail.
$(l)Eats:$() N/A$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Raw Bug Meat$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Small Eggs$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Egg Collection Phial
